org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.render.domain
Class IntTickFormatter

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.render.domain.TickFormatter
      org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.render.domain.IntTickFormatter

public class IntTickFormatter
extends TickFormatter

Formats domain axis ticks as plain integer values.

Author:
chad takahashi

getTickInterval

public double getTickInterval()
Description copied from class: TickFormatter
Returns a positive value corresponding to a single tick for this formatter. For example, if this is a day-of-month formatter, then this method would return TimeUnit.ms().

Specified by:
getTickInterval in class TickFormatter

getSubTickStep

public int getSubTickStep(int primaryTickStep)
Description copied from class: TickFormatter
Returns a suitable sub-tick step size for the given 'primaryTickStep' (i.e. the tick spacing to be used for the labeled ticks).

Overrides:
getSubTickStep in class TickFormatter

incrementTick

public int incrementTick(int numTickSteps)
Description copied from class: TickFormatter
Increments currTick by the specified number of tick steps. Subclasses may sometimes need to override this method to modify the actual number of tick steps in order to ensure that the associated tick labels are stable when scrolling.

Specified by:
incrementTick in class TickFormatter
Returns:
the number of tick steps that were *actually* incremented; typically, this value will be the same as the numTickSteps input parameter, but in the aforementioned subclass override case, a different value could get returned (the typical case for this is a date near the end of a month).

resetToQuantizedTick

public void resetToQuantizedTick(double domainX,
                                 int tickStep)
Description copied from class: TickFormatter
Quantizes domainX to the nearest tickStep and sets this quantized value as the current tick. For example, suppose that:
  • this is a MonthTickFormatter,
  • timeStamp = JUN-19-1985:22hrs:36min...
  • tickStep = 3 (in this context, '3' refers to 3 months).
This method would then return APR-1-1985:0hrs:0min, ....

Specified by:
resetToQuantizedTick in class TickFormatter
Parameters:
domainX - -The domain value to be quantized
tickStep - - The tick step to which domainX will be quantized

toString in class java.lang.Object
